headline.print_headline: Scars From a Revolution Ache 50 Years Later
headline.main: 50 Years After the Cultural Revolution, a Son Awaits Answers on His Father’s Death

snippet: Chen Shuxiang’s father was killed by Red Guards in the first spasms of Mao’s Cultural Revolution. He has never learned why his father was singled out or what happened to his body.
abstract: Chen Shuxiang, whose father was murdered by Red Guards during Mao Zedong's bloody Cultural Revolution in China, knows little about what happened to her father and continues to seek answers; Pres Xi Jinping was also victimized by Mao's revolution but has made favorable comments towards him in country that has tried to suppress shameful past.
